results.title: The Sleep of reason
results.creator_credit: Mathews Jordan Production, Australian Film Commission, Sue Mathews and Peter Jordan
results.brief_description: The exploding of the atomic bomb over Hiroshima on August 6, 1945 made possible the apocalyptic extermination of the human race. This complex and moving documentary traces the history of human visions of “apocalypse”. Through an exploration of the vast canvases of Heironymous Bosch and Bruegel, the Japanese “monster” movies of the 1950s and the home-movies taken at the Nevada site at Las Alamos where the first nuclear tests were undertaken, “The Sleep of Reason” is an insight into the unconscious fears that underlie religious myths of punishment and redemption. However, the explosion of the bomb over Hiroshima dragged the apocalypse from mythology into reality and since that cataclysmic event, humanity has had to learn to live with the knowledge that it has the power to destroy itself. Filmed in the rebuilt city of Hiroshima, the film interviews philosopher George Steiner, psychoanalyst Robert Lifton, art historian Donald Kuspit and film writer Vivian Sobchack who all offer interpretations on how the bomb has affected global culture. An excerpt from an interview with Robert Oppenheimer, who breaks into tears as he talks about his work on creating the atomic bomb, is also included in this remarkable film.

results.title: The Slave
results.brief_description: When a struggling young sculptor can’t support his family his Greek wife offers to sell herself as a slave. Cast includes Florence Lawrence, Harry Solter, James Kirkwood, Mack Sennett, Mary Pickford. Silent film with no intertitles.

results.title: The Sky Pirates (Captioned)
results.brief_description: When their model plane crashes at the Aero Club, Mike and Harry are befriended by ex-pilot, Charlie Bradford, and his niece, Maggie, who teach them to fly radio controlled planes. Charlie invites them to the test flight of his new long distance aircraft which is later stolen. When they learn that a diamond has been stolen from the French State Museum, they realise the plane is to be used to smuggle the diamond out of the country.

results.title: The Sky is gray
results.creator_credit: Perspective Films, Whitney Green and Stan Lathan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
Based on a short story by Ernest Gaines. Deals with a young black farmboy’s visit to the dentist in a small Louisiana town in the 1940’s. The visit marks the dawning of his social and self-awareness. Commentary by Henry Fonda. Cast: Olivia Cole, James Bond III.

results.title: The Sky is blue
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall and Richard Raxlen
results.brief_description: A fanciful story, done in paper cut-outs, of a boy’s journey through the skies on the tail of a kite. He soars high above the earth, encountering birds, aeroplanes, the stars, a spaceship and other heavenly bodies before floating back to his starting point. An animated film for children. Film without words.

results.title: The Sky
results.creator_credit: Coastal Community Colleges and David P. Stone
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
Ancient skywatchers observed the passing phases of the moon and movements of the sun, planets and stars to determine direction, time and the seasonal cyclical rhythms. Structures like Stonehenge were seasonal calendars based on astronomical observations and although different cultures saw formations of stars differently, the use of constellations to determine directions and seasons was commonplace. The Greeks were the first race to apply mathematical principles to their astronomical observations.

results.title: The Skin as a sense organ
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
Human beings have seven senses of the skin that provide information about the outside world. Looking beneath the skin with a microscope reveals that each sense may be associated with a different type of nerve ending.

results.title: The Skeleton. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Studies the relationship of speed of movement of the exoskeleton/endoskeleton of animals. Focuses on the human skeleton, showing the various parts and indicating the muscle contractions that lead to skeleton movement. Also indicates the physical and chemical structure of bone and provides an illustration of the strength of hollow bone compared with solid bone. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description: Studies the relationship of speed of movement of the exoskeleton/endoskeleton of animals. results.title: The Sixth sense [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Spyglass Entertainment, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Barry Mendel and M Night Shyamalan
results.brief_description: This low key supernatural thriller harks back to the days of Val Lewton and Jacques Tourneur’s creepy horror films (“Cat people”, “The Leopard man”, “I walked with a zombie”) where the power of suggestion reigned and a mere shadow would have you jumping in your seat. So to does “The Sixth sense” manage to create that feeling of unknowable dread and terror. The film’s opening sets the mood of unease when renowned child psychologist Dr. Malcolm Crowe (Bruce Willis) is accosted in his home by a disturbed ex-client. Flash forward one year and Dr. Crow is trying to mend the past by helping a new patient, who shares similar traits to his assailant. The patient is Cole Sear (Joel Haley Osment), a troubled young boy who lives his life in constant fear. Why he is scared all the time is one of the many creepy surprises this film holds. What could have easily been a substandard supernatural thriller is elevated by writer, director M. Night Shyamalan and his fine cast (which includes Toni Collette who shines in a all too brief supporting role), all of them showing a quiet restraint which pays off brilliantly in the film’s more frightening moments. Cast also includes Olivia Williams.
